channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Robust Representation Consistency Model via Contrastive Denoising
item.description: For example, our method outperforms the certified accuracy of diffusion-based methods on ImageNet across all perturbation radii by 5. 3% on average, with up to 11. 6% at larger radii, while reducing inference costs by 85$\times$ on average.

item.title: FlanEC: Exploring Flan-T5 for Post-ASR Error Correction
item.description: In this paper, we present an encoder-decoder model leveraging Flan-T5 for post-Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) Generative Speech Error Correction (GenSEC), and we refer to it as FlanEC.

item.title: GAMED-Snake: Gradient-aware Adaptive Momentum Evolution Deep Snake Model for Multi-organ Segmentation
item.description: Multi-organ segmentation is a critical yet challenging task due to complex anatomical backgrounds, blurred boundaries, and diverse morphologies.

item.title: Online Preference Alignment for Language Models via Count-based Exploration
item.description: Then, we reformulate our objective to direct preference optimization with an exploration term, where the UCB-term can be converted to a count-based exploration bonus.

item.title: OnionEval: An Unified Evaluation of Fact-conflicting Hallucination for Small-Large Language Models
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) are highly capable but require significant computational resources for both training and inference.

item.title: Patent Figure Classification using Large Vision-language Models
item.description: Patent figure classification facilitates faceted search in patent retrieval systems, enabling efficient prior art search.

item.title: VideoLLaMA 3: Frontier Multimodal Foundation Models for Image and Video Understanding
item.description: The key insight of our vision-centric training paradigm is that high-quality image-text data is crucial for both image and video understanding.

item.title: ViDDAR: Vision Language Model-Based Task-Detrimental Content Detection for Augmented Reality
item.description: In Augmented Reality (AR), virtual content enhances user experience by providing additional information.

item.title: STMDNet: A Lightweight Directional Framework for Motion Pattern Recognition of Tiny Targets
item.description: Recognizing motions of tiny targets - only few dozen pixels - in cluttered backgrounds remains a fundamental challenge when standard feature-based or deep learning methods fail under scarce visual cues.

item.title: TimeFilter: Patch-Specific Spatial-Temporal Graph Filtration for Time Series Forecasting
item.description: Current time series forecasting methods can be broadly classified into two categories: Channel Independent (CI) and Channel Dependent (CD) strategies, both aiming to capture the complex dependencies within time series data.

item.title: Multi-Objective Hyperparameter Selection via Hypothesis Testing on Reliability Graphs
item.description: The proposed approach, RG-based PT (RG-PT), leverages the RG to enable the efficient, parallel testing of multiple hyperparameters at the same reliability level.

item.title: FDG-Diff: Frequency-Domain-Guided Diffusion Framework for Compressed Hazy Image Restoration
item.description: In this study, we reveal that the interaction between haze degradation and JPEG compression introduces complex joint loss effects, which significantly complicate image restoration.

item.title: TeD-Loc: Text Distillation for Weakly Supervised Object Localization
item.description: Weakly supervised object localization (WSOL) using classification models trained with only image-class labels remains an important challenge in computer vision.

item.title: Hybrid Losses for Hierarchical Embedding Learning
item.description: In traditional supervised learning, the cross-entropy loss treats all incorrect predictions equally, ignoring the relevance or proximity of wrong labels to the correct answer.

item.title: Test-Time Preference Optimization: On-the-Fly Alignment via Iterative Textual Feedback
item.description: In this work, we introduce Test-time Preference Optimization (TPO), a framework that aligns LLM outputs with human preferences during inference, removing the need to update model parameters.

item.title: REX: Causal Discovery based on Machine Learning and Explainability techniques
item.description: Explainability techniques hold significant potential for enhancing the causal discovery process, which is crucial for understanding complex systems in areas like healthcare, economics, and artificial intelligence.

item.title: PPO-Based Vehicle Control for Ramp Merging Scheme Assisted by Enhanced C-V2X
item.description: On-ramp merging presents a critical challenge in autonomous driving, as vehicles from merging lanes need to dynamically adjust their positions and speeds while monitoring traffic on the main road to prevent collisions.

item.title: A Unified Invariant Learning Framework for Graph Classification
item.description: It provides a unified perspective on invariant graph learning, emphasizing both structural and semantic invariance principles to identify more robust stable features.

item.title: Estimating the Conformal Prediction Threshold from Noisy Labels
item.description: Conformal Prediction (CP) is a method to control prediction uncertainty by producing a small prediction set, ensuring a predetermined probability that the true class lies within this set.

item.title: Machine Learning Modeling for Multi-order Human Visual Motion Processing
item.description: While recent advances in computer vision (CV) have enabled DNN-based models to accurately estimate optical flow in naturalistic images, a significant disparity remains between CV models and the biological visual system in both architecture and behavior.

item.title: Does Table Source Matter? Benchmarking and Improving Multimodal Scientific Table Understanding and Reasoning
item.description: While multimodal large language models (MLLMs) enable direct visual processing, they face limitations in handling scientific tables due to fixed input image resolutions and insufficient numerical reasoning capabilities.

item.title: Pairwise RM: Perform Best-of-N Sampling with Knockout Tournament
item.description: To address this, we propose a Pairwise Reward Model (Pairwise RM) combined with a knockout tournament for BoN sampling.

item.title: Regularization, Semi-supervision, and Supervision for a Plausible Attention-Based Explanation
item.description: We thus propose 3 additional constraints to the learning objective function to improve the plausibility of the attention map: regularization to increase the attention weight sparsity, semi-supervision to supervise the map by a heuristic and supervision by human annotation.

item.title: O1-Pruner: Length-Harmonizing Fine-Tuning for O1-Like Reasoning Pruning
item.description: Experiments on various mathematical reasoning benchmarks show that O1-Pruner not only significantly reduces inference overhead but also achieves higher accuracy, providing a novel and promising solution to this challenge.

item.title: Distillation Quantification for Large Language Models
item.description: Model distillation is a technique for transferring knowledge from large language models (LLMs) to smaller ones, aiming to create resource-efficient yet high-performing models.

item.title: On Accelerating Deep Neural Network Mutation Analysis by Neuron and Mutant Clustering
item.description: When compared to exhaustive, or vanilla, mutation analysis, the results provide empirical evidence that neuron clustering approach, on average, accelerates mutation analysis by 69. 77%, with an average -26. 84% error in mutation score.

item.title: The Marginal Importance of Distortions and Alignment in CASSI systems
item.description: This paper introduces a differentiable ray-tracing based model that incorporates aberrations and distortions to render realistic coded hyperspectral acquisitions using Coded-Aperture Spectral Snapshot Imagers (CASSI).

item.title: Learning Versatile Optimizers on a Compute Diet
item.description: Learned optimization has emerged as a promising alternative to hand-crafted optimizers, with the potential to discover stronger learned update rules that enable faster, hyperparameter-free training of neural networks.

item.title: Multi-Instance Partial-Label Learning with Margin Adjustment
item.description: Multi-instance partial-label learning (MIPL) is an emerging learning framework where each training sample is represented as a multi-instance bag associated with a candidate label set.

item.title: Large-image Object Detection for Fine-grained Recognition of Punches Patterns in Medieval Panel Painting
item.description: The attribution of the author of an art piece is typically a laborious manual process, usually relying on subjective evaluations of expert figures.

item.title: Hunyuan3D 2.0: Scaling Diffusion Models for High Resolution Textured 3D Assets Generation
item.description: This system includes two foundation components: a large-scale shape generation model -- Hunyuan3D-DiT, and a large-scale texture synthesis model -- Hunyuan3D-Paint.

item.title: TabularARGN: A Flexible and Efficient Auto-Regressive Framework for Generating High-Fidelity Synthetic Data
item.description: Synthetic data generation for tabular datasets must balance fidelity, efficiency, and versatility to meet the demands of real-world applications.

item.title: Multi-Modality Collaborative Learning for Sentiment Analysis
item.description: In this paper, by introducing a Multi-Modality Collaborative Learning (MMCL) framework, we facilitate cross-modal interactions and capture enhanced and complementary features from modality-common and modality-specific representations, respectively.

item.title: Utilising Deep Learning to Elicit Expert Uncertainty
item.description: Recent work [ 14 ] has introduced a method for prior elicitation that utilizes records of expert decisions to infer a prior distribution.

item.title: Budget-constrained Collaborative Renewable Energy Forecasting Market
item.description: Accurate power forecasting from renewable energy sources (RES) is crucial for integrating additional RES capacity into the power system and realizing sustainability goals.

item.title: HERITAGE: An End-to-End Web Platform for Processing Korean Historical Documents in Hanja
item.description: First, anyone interested in these documents can get a general understanding from the model predictions and the interactive glossary, especially MT outputs in Korean and English.

item.title: MirrorCBO: A consensus-based optimization method in the spirit of mirror descent
item.description: In this work we propose MirrorCBO, a consensus-based optimization (CBO) method which generalizes standard CBO in the same way that mirror descent generalizes gradient descent.

item.title: MedS$^3$: Towards Medical Small Language Models with Self-Evolved Slow Thinking
item.description: In this work, we present a deployable, small-scale medical language model, \mone, designed for long-chain reasoning in clinical tasks using a self-evolution paradigm.

item.title: Automating High Quality RT Planning at Scale
item.description: Radiotherapy (RT) planning is complex, subjective, and time-intensive.

item.title: MoGERNN: An Inductive Traffic Predictor for Unobserved Locations in Dynamic Sensing Networks
item.description: Given a partially observed road network, how can we predict the traffic state of unobserved locations?

item.title: ALoFTRAG: Automatic Local Fine Tuning for Retrieval Augmented Generation
item.description: Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) systems have been shown to improve the accuracy of Large Language Model (LLM) outputs.

item.title: Federated Discrete Denoising Diffusion Model for Molecular Generation with OpenFL
item.description: The federated model achieves comparable performance with a model trained on centralized data when evaluating the uniqueness and validity of the generated molecules.

item.title: TabularARGN: A Flexible and Efficient Auto-Regressive Framework for Generating High-Fidelity Synthetic Data
item.description: Synthetic data generation for tabular datasets must balance fidelity, efficiency, and versatility to meet the demands of real-world applications.

item.title: HAC++: Towards 100X Compression of 3D Gaussian Splatting
item.description: 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS) has emerged as a promising framework for novel view synthesis, boasting rapid rendering speed with high fidelity.

item.title: VARGPT: Unified Understanding and Generation in a Visual Autoregressive Multimodal Large Language Model
item.description: We present VARGPT, a novel multimodal large language model (MLLM) that unifies visual understanding and generation within a single autoregressive framework.

item.title: Noise-Resilient Point-wise Anomaly Detection in Time Series Using Weak Segment Labels
item.description: Detecting anomalies in temporal data has gained significant attention across various real-world applications, aiming to identify unusual events and mitigate potential hazards.

item.title: EDoRA: Efficient Weight-Decomposed Low-Rank Adaptation via Singular Value Decomposition
item.description: Parameter-efficient fine-tuning methods, such as LoRA, reduces the number of trainable parameters.

item.title: InternLM-XComposer2.5-Reward: A Simple Yet Effective Multi-Modal Reward Model
item.description: Despite the promising performance of Large Vision Language Models (LVLMs) in visual understanding, they occasionally generate incorrect outputs.

item.title: Physics of Skill Learning
item.description: We aim to understand physics of skill learning, i. e., how skills are learned in neural networks during training.

item.title: Expertise elevates AI usage: experimental evidence comparing laypeople and professional artists
item.description: Novel capacities of generative AI to analyze and generate cultural artifacts raise inevitable questions about the nature and value of artistic education and human expertise.
